instructions: Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 1 1 Open Chrome. Tap the red, green, yellow, and blue spherical app icon. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 2 2 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 3 3 Tap . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . It's near the bottom of the page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 5 5 Tap . You'll find this option near the top of the screen. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 6 6 Tap the grey Cookies Image titled Android7switchoff.png switch. It will turn blue or green Image titled Android7switchon.png . Doing so enables cookies. If the Cookies switch is blue or green, Cookies are already enabled. You can also check the "Allow third-party cookies" box near the top of the page to allow websites to view your cookies. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 7 7 Tap the "Back" button. It's in the top-left corner of the screen. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 8 8 Tap . This option is near the middle of the Site Settings page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 9 9 Tap the grey JavaScript Image titled Android7switchoff.png switch. It will slide right and turn blue or green Image titled Android7switchon.png . Doing so enables JavaScript on your Android's Chrome browser. If the JavaScript switch is blue or green, JavaScript is already enabled. Advertisement

Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 20 1 Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles a blue globe with an orange fox wrapped around it. You cannot enable JavaScript in the Firefox mobile app, given that JavaScript is permanently enabled in Firefox. You can still enable cookies on Android, however. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 21 2 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 22 3 Tap . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 23 4 Tap the tab. It's on the left side of the screen. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 24 5 Tap . This option is near the top of the page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 25 6 Tap the option. Doing so will enable cookies for your Firefox browser. Advertisement

Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 63 1 Open your iPhone's Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png Settings. Tap the grey app with gears on it. You'll typically find this app on the Home Screen. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 64 2 Scroll down and tap . It's about a third of the way down the Settings page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 65 3 Scroll down and tap . You'll find this near the middle of the page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 66 4 Tap . Doing so enables cookies in your Safari app. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 67 5 Tap . It's in the top-left corner of the screen. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 68 6 Scroll down and tap . This option is at the bottom of the page. Image titled Enable Cookies and JavaScript Step 69 7 Tap the white Javascript Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png switch. It will turn green Image titled Iphoneswitchonicon1.png , signifying that you have enabled JavaScript for Safari. Advertisement

Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 1 1 Open Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png Settings. It's a grey app with gears on it. Make sure that you're doing this on your child's iPhone. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 2 2 Tap the Apple ID name card. This option is at the top of the Settings page. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 3 3 Tap . It's in the middle of the screen. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . This is near the bottom of the page. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 5 5 Tap the white "Find My iPhone" switch Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png . It will turn green Image titled Iphoneswitchonicon1.png which signifies that Find My iPhone is now active on your child's phone. If this switch is green, Find My iPhone is already active on your child's iPhone. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 6 6 Tap the white "Send Last Location" switch Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png . This option ensures that your child's phone will mark a GPS coordinate before its battery dies, making it easier to pinpoint where they were before their phone went offline. If this switch is green, the "Send Last Location" feature is already enabled. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 7 7 Return to the Settings page. Tap the "Back" button in the top left corner of the screen three times. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 8 8 Scroll down and tap Image titled Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png General. It's in the third group of options. Now that Find My iPhone is enabled, you should prevent your child from disabling it by setting a restriction for it. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 9 9 Scroll down and tap . This option is near the middle of the page. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 10 10 Enter your Restrictions password. Type in the four-digit passcode that you use to access the Restrictions menu on your child's phone. If you haven't yet set up Restrictions, tap Enable Restrictions , enter a password that you want to use, and then re-enter it when prompted. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 11 11 Scroll down and tap . You'll find this option in the "PRIVACY" group of options near the bottom of the page. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 12 12 Tap . You'll see a blue checkmark appear to the right of this option, signifying that your child won't be able to disable Find My iPhone from within Settings. Find My iPhone still won't work if the phone is off or in Airplane Mode. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 13 13 Find your child's phone. To see a phone on your Apple ID account (or your child's Apple ID account, if different), go to https://www.icloud.com/ in your browser and log in with the Apple ID account's credentials, then do the following: Click Find My iPhone Click All Devices at the top of the window. Click your child's phone. Wait for the results to appear. You can also use the built-in Find My iPhone app on your iPhone by opening the app, signing in with your Apple ID (or your child's Apple ID if it's different), and tapping the phone in question. Advertisement

Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 14 1 Open the Image titled Androidgoogleplay.png Google Play Store. Make sure that you're doing this on your child's phone, not your own. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 15 2 Tap the search bar. It's at the top of the screen. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 16 3 Type in find my device . Doing so will prompt a drop-down list of results. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 17 4 Tap . It's at the top of the list of results. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 18 5 Tap . You'll find this green button on the far-right side of the Find My Device page. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 19 6 Tap when prompted. Doing so will download Find My Device onto your child's Android. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 20 7 Open Find My Device. Tap OPEN in the Google Play app when it appears. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 21 8 Tap . It's a green button in the middle of the screen. "NAME" will be replaced by your child's first name. If you see a SIGN IN option here, tap that instead. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 22 9 Enter your child's Google account information. This may include their email address and password, though you may just need to enter the password or select their account from a list if they're already logged into their Google account. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 23 10 Make sure that you can see the phone. In order to track your child's phone via Find My Device, your child's phone must have location services enabled. If you can't see the phone in Find My Device, do the following: Open the Android's Settings Tap Location Tap the grey or white "Enable location settings" switch Image titled Android7switchoff.png . If this switch is colored (e.g., blue), location services are already enabled. Image titled Set Up Cell Phone Tracking for a Child's Cell Phone Step 24 11 Find your child's Android. Go to the Find My Device website ( https://www.google.com/android/find ) on any computer and sign in with your child's Google account information, then select their phone to see where it is. You can also sign into the Find My Device app on your phone using your child's credentials to monitor their whereabouts. Advertisement
